text:
My PDF builds beautifully, but the logs have two entries with the following:

     [java] INFO    10068   [fop     ] (): [38]
     [java] ERROR   10068   [fop     ] (): >
     [java] INFO    10068   [fop     ] (): [39]
     [java] ERROR   10068   [fop     ] (): >

And then the rest renders OK.

How do I tell if there is an illegal construct in my XML?  The two error entries
do not give me any clue.
creator: bloritsch@apache.org
jeremias.maerki@outline.ch
text:
This is not really an error. ">" is a warning/error that some text couldn't fit 
within its container. There is nothing wrong with your XML.

Perhaps it should #1 be down-graded to WARN (less alarming) and #2 change the
text to read:

     [java] WARNING 10068 [fop      ] (): Text could not fit in it's container
creator: bloritsch@apache.org
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
